TopicTitle: [PART, 1.0.2] Anatid Robotics / MuMech - MechJeb - Autopilot - Historical thread

Articles.Content:
I've run into a weird issue with MechJeb. Mechjeb isn't turning my ships for some reason. Smart ASS isn't working, ascent guidance's turn isn't turning, and the maneuver planner isn't pointing the ship. I'm not seeing any errors in the log. Any ideas as to what could be causing this?

Edited March 24, 2015 by SaintWacko

I've run into a weird issue with MechJeb. Mechjeb isn't turning my ships for some reason Smart ASS isn't working, ascent guidance's turn isn't turning, and the maneuver planner isn't pointing the ship. I'm not seeing any errors in the log. Any ideas as to what could be causing this?

DId you run out of electricity? Kind of the first question you gotta ask in that situation if it isn't obvious that you do have EC.

DId you run out of electricity? Kind of the first question you gotta ask in that situation if it isn't obvious that you do have EC.

Sorry, should have specified. I have plenty of electricity, I can manually control the rocket perfectly fine, and SAS works fine. It's just Mechjeb that can't turn the craft. I've tried it with multiple craft designs, to make sure it wasn't a part I had on it.

Edited March 24, 2015 by SaintWacko

Hm, is it able to turn while in space? Just asking since you didn't really say that.

Also, maybe a picture of the craft?
A picture with the Attitude Adjustment windows open would help.

Hm, is it able to turn while in space? Just asking since you didn't really say that.

Also, maybe a picture of the craft?

Mechjeb still can't turn it in space. Here's the current ship I'm launching. My turn start altitude is set to 1km, and as you can see, I'm at 41km and still no turn. Edit: new picture with attitude adjustment window

Edited March 24, 2015 by SaintWacko
Added Attitude Adjustment window

Try the latest dev version and see if that fixes anything? That's all I can think of.

What are those two spherical parts on the top of the rocket?

Edit : oops you did

The windows clearly show that some torque is available so I don't understand why it does not try to turn.

As smjjames sugested try with the dev releases . A lot was fixed since the last offical.

Edited March 24, 2015 by sarbian

Try the latest dev version and see if that fixes anything? That's all I can think of.

What are those two spherical parts on the top of the rocket?

They're from the Habitat Pack mod.

Edit : oops you did

The windows clearly show that some torque is available so I don't understand why it does not try to turn.

As smjjames sugested try with the dev releases . A lot was fixed since the last offical.

I'll try that. I actually thought I was running the latest dev release, but I forgot I started using CKAN again, and it just has the official release.

Indeed, MJ dev seems to be gone from CKAN. Strange since Hakan auomated the update. I'll ask him.

Edit : it is still here. In CKAN go to Setting, push New and select the "MechJeb2-Dev" repo and press OK. Then refresh you CKAN.

Edited March 24, 2015 by sarbian

Indeed, MJ dev seems to be gone from CKAN. Strange since Hakan auomated the update. I'll ask him.

Edit : it is still here. In CKAN go to Setting, push New and select the "MechJeb2-Dev" repo and press OK. Then refresh you CKAN.

Ah, okay! Well, in the meantime I've installed it manually. I still can't turn, though.

That is quite strange

Post a log so I can see your mod list and what could go wrong.

That is quite strange

Post a log so I can see your mod list and what could go wrong.

The KSP.log file?
Yes, that should do.

Yes, that should do.

It's quite a large file. Here's a link to it. I'll warn you now, I run a lot of mods, so it's entirely possible that one of them is conflicting. However, I've been running a very similar mod list for quite a while with no issues. https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bw6pRYvIkMwcOERPbjhLZjh6SGc/view?usp=sharing
Hm, now it's turning my ship again. In a different save, though. Interesting.

I'm not 100% sure if it's ship design or something with mechjeb, but I've noticed that it sometimes has problems controlling the left and right movement (parallel to the ground) while in ascent, adding on fins/wings usually fixes this though.

Hm, now it's turning my ship again. In a different save, though. Interesting.

My experience with it is that it's been a very intermittent phenomenon. I've definitely experienced what you're talking about but fortunately it's been rare for me. MJ doesn't even try to turn the ship when it happens. Sometimes aborting then re-executing the command breaks it out of its funk. If it's a maneuver node sometimes I have to re-create the node.

It might also have been responsible for a failed launch attempt where I left the room, came back 3 minutes later to see that instead of approaching orbit, I was at 3km and heading nose first into the ocean....

One of these days I'll get around to scouring my log. Or maybe I'll take a look at yours and see if I can find anything to report back with.

My experience with it is that it's been a very intermittent phenomenon. I've definitely experienced what you're talking about but fortunately it's been rare for me. MJ doesn't even try to turn the ship when it happens. Sometimes aborting then re-executing the command breaks it out of its funk. If it's a maneuver node sometimes I have to re-create the node.

It might also have been responsible for a failed launch attempt where I left the room, came back 3 minutes later to see that instead of approaching orbit, I was at 3km and heading nose first into the ocean....

One of these days I'll get around to scouring my log. Or maybe I'll take a look at yours and see if I can find anything to report back with.

It seems to be on environment change that it switches between working and not. I was approaching Minmus and it was working just fine, now I'm trying to circularize 16km above the surface and it won't change the heading.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, hello! I think I've found the problem. Or at least something that will allow sarbian to track it down. The issue is that, for some reason, stock SAS is getting turned on, even though it doesn't show it. I turned off Smart ASS, toggled SAS on and back off, then tried using Smart ASS again, and it worked! Now, I haven't done any testing, so I don't know that that was it for sure, but it fixed it for me. Once I finish this flight I'll see if I can do some testing.

Edit: Happened again during this flight, and I was able to fix it the same way.

Edit edit: Don't even have to turn Smart ASS off. If this happens to you, just tap F to fix it.

Edited March 25, 2015 by SaintWacko

Is it possible to get separate PID values for yaw, pitch and roll?

Also, having the ability to save/load PIDs would be great. I'm so sick of readjusting PIDs from memory each time my ssto dramatically changes mass, speed or altitude or switches to another set of engines.

Consider this a request.

It is doable but I m afraid it would become an UI bloat. I'll see what I can do to not make it too large.

But I would rather have a method that adjust itself better. What is your main problem with the current system ? Oscillation in atmo, control too violent, ... ? Do you use FAR/NEAR and if so do you have the Mechjeb Extension for those ? Is it with MJ dev (version ?) or release ?

So I've got a question. Does MechJeb's Delta-V stats thing account for Lift in the TWR calculator? Because I've got a rocket-powered Spaceplane that according to MechJeb only has a starting TWR of .74, but I've been able to fly it quite well since I first built it before even unlocking MechJeb. It's a pretty simple design using 3 AV-R8 winglets (2 for the canards, 1 for the tail), 2 Type B Wing Connectors (each with a lift rating of 2), the Mk 1 Cockpit, the Science Jr., two FL-T400s and a LV-909 with tricycle landing gear.
Lift is not thrust, and shouldn't be included in TWR calculations. Most real life aircraft have TWR<1, often quite significantly so.

It seems to be on environment change that it switches between working and not. I was approaching Minmus and it was working just fine, now I'm trying to circularize 16km above the surface and it won't change the heading.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, hello! I think I've found the problem. Or at least something that will allow sarbian to track it down. The issue is that, for some reason, stock SAS is getting turned on, even though it doesn't show it. I turned off Smart ASS, toggled SAS on and back off, then tried using Smart ASS again, and it worked! Now, I haven't done any testing, so I don't know that that was it for sure, but it fixed it for me. Once I finish this flight I'll see if I can do some testing.

Edit: Happened again during this flight, and I was able to fix it the same way.

Edit edit: Don't even have to turn Smart ASS off. If this happens to you, just tap F to fix it.

That seems unlikely. I had it happen on a ship that didn't even have SAS available. (career game w/ scientist as the sole occupant)

Looking at the change logs, there were some attitude controller changes made here: in build #412

I think that was the build where this problem started and those were the sole changes. (some additions to MathExtensions and significant changes to the attitude controller)
hum, the test in "set" of attitudeTarget could relate to that. But if I don't have a repeatable case I won't be able to fix it ...
